Supported Services

column1: How to create a contact file
column2: How to create a contact file
Invalid file format.
Microsoft Outlook

column1: To export a CSV file from Microsoft Outlook:
column2: To export a CSV file from Microsoft Outlook:
1. Open Outlook

column1: 2. Go to File menu and select 'Import and Export'
column2: 2. Go to File menu and select 'Import and Export'

column1: 3. In the wizard window that appears, select 'Export to a file' and click 'Next'
column2: 3. In the wizard window that appears, select 'Export to a file' and click 'Next'
4. Select 'Comma separated values (Windows)' and click 'Next'

column1: 5. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Next'
column2: 5. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Next'

column1: 6. Ensure that the checkbox next to 'Export..' is checked and click 'Finish'.
column2: 6. Ensure that the checkbox next to 'Export..' is checked and click 'Finish'.
Microsoft Outlook Express

column1: To export a CSV file from Microsoft Outlook Express:
column2: To export a CSV file from Microsoft Outlook Express:
1. Open Outlook Express

column1: 2. Go to File menu and select 'Export', and then click 'Address Book'
column2: 2. Go to File menu and select 'Export', and then click 'Address Book'

column1: 3. Select 'Text File (Comma Separated Values)', and then click 'Export'
column2: 3. Select 'Text File (Comma Separated Values)', and then click 'Export'

column1: 4. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Next'
column2: 4. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Next'

column1: 5. Select the check boxes for the fields that you want to export (be sure to select the email address field), and then click 'Finish'.
column2: 5. Select the check boxes for the fields that you want to export (be sure to select the email address field), and then click 'Finish'.
Mozilla Thunderbird

column1: To export a CSV file from Mozilla Thunderbird:
column2: To export a CSV file from Mozilla Thunderbird:
1. Open Mozilla Thunderbird

column1: 2. Go to Tools menu and select 'Address Book'
column2: 2. Go to Tools menu and select 'Address Book'

column1: 3. In the 'Address Book' window that opens, select 'Export...' from the Tools menu
column2: 3. In the 'Address Book' window that opens, select 'Export...' from the Tools menu

column1: 4. Select where you want to save the exported file, choose 'Comma Separated (*.CSV)' under the 'Save as type' dropdown list, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Save'.
column2: 4. Select where you want to save the exported file, choose 'Comma Separated (*.CSV)' under the 'Save as type' dropdown list, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv) and click 'Save'.
LinkedIn

column1: To export a CSV file from LinkedIn:
column2: To export a CSV file from LinkedIn:
1. Sign into your LinkedIn account
2. Visit the
Address Book Export
Showroom

column1: 3. Select 'Microsoft Outlook (.CSV file)' under the 'Export to' dropdown list and click 'Export'
column2: 3. Select 'Microsoft Outlook (.CSV file)' under the 'Export to' dropdown list and click 'Export'

column1: 4. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv).
column2: 4. Select where you want to save the exported CSV file, choose a name for your file (example : mycontacts.csv).
Windows Address Book

column1: To export a CSV file from Windows Address Book:
column2: To export a CSV file from Windows Address Book:
1. Open Windows Address Book

column1: 2. Go to the File menu, select 'Export', and then select 'Other Address Book...'
column2: 2. Go to the File menu, select 'Export', and then select 'Other Address Book...'

column1: 3. In the 'Address Book Export Tool' dialog that opens, select 'Text File (Comma Separated Values)' and click 'Export'
column2: 3. In the 'Address Book Export Tool' dialog that opens, select 'Text File (Comma Separated Values)' and click 'Export'
6. Click 'OK' and then click 'Close'
Mac OS X Address Book

column1: To export a CSV file from Mac OS X Address Book:
column2: To export a CSV file from Mac OS X Address Book:

column1: 1. Download the free Mac Address Book exporter from
column2: 1. Download the free Mac Address Book exporter from

column1: 2. Choose to export your Address Book in CSV format.
column2: 2. Choose to export your Address Book in CSV format.

column1: 3. Save your exported address book in CSV format.
column2: 3. Save your exported address book in CSV format.
Palm Desktop

column1: To export a CSV file from Palm Desktop:
column2: To export a CSV file from Palm Desktop:
1. Open Palm Desktop

column1: 2. Click on the 'Addresses' icon on the lefthand side of the screen to display your contact list
column2: 2. Click on the 'Addresses' icon on the lefthand side of the screen to display your contact list

column1: 3. Go to the File menu, select 'Export'
column2: 3. Go to the File menu, select 'Export'

column1: 4. In the dialog box that opens, do the following:
column2: 4. In the dialog box that opens, do the following:

column1: 5. Enter a name for the file you are creating in the 'File name:' field
column2: 5. Enter a name for the file you are creating in the 'File name:' field

column1: 6. Select 'Comma Separated' in the 'Export Type' pulldown menu
column2: 6. Select 'Comma Separated' in the 'Export Type' pulldown menu

column1: 7. Be sure to select the 'All' radio button from the two 'Range:' radio buttons
column2: 7. Be sure to select the 'All' radio button from the two 'Range:' radio buttons

column1: 8. In the second dialog box: 'Specify Export Fields' that opens, leave all of the checkboxes checked, and click 'OK'.
column2: 8. In the second dialog box: 'Specify Export Fields' that opens, leave all of the checkboxes checked, and click 'OK'.
Windows Mail

column1: To export a CSV file from Windows Mail:
column2: To export a CSV file from Windows Mail:
1. Open Windows Mail

column1: 2. Select: Tools | Windows Contacts... from the menu in Windows Mail
column2: 2. Select: Tools | Windows Contacts... from the menu in Windows Mail
3. Click 'Export' in the toolbar

column1: 4. Make sure CSV (Comma Separated Values) is highlighted, then click 'Export'
column2: 4. Make sure CSV (Comma Separated Values) is highlighted, then click 'Export'
6. Click 'Save' then click 'Next'

column1: 7. Make sure all address book fields you want included are checked
column2: 7. Make sure all address book fields you want included are checked
8. Click 'Finish'
9. Click 'OK' then click 'Close'

Contact Importer Settings
Yahoo Contact Importer Settings
API Key
Shared Secret
Getting Yahoo API Key :-

column1: 1) Go here to register your application:
column2: 1) Go here to register your application:
About creating your application :-

column1: a) Write your application name. You can make this the same as your site name.
column2: a) Write your application name. You can make this the same as your site name.

column1: b) In the 'Kind of Application' field, choose : 'Web-based'.
column2: b) In the 'Kind of Application' field, choose : 'Web-based'.

column1: c) Write a short description about your application/website.
column2: c) Write a short description about your application/website.

column1: d) In the 'Application URL' field, write the URL of your site (example : http://www.mysite.com).
column2: d) In the 'Application URL' field, write the URL of your site (example : http://www.mysite.com).
Security & Privacy:-

column1: a) In the 'Application Domain' field, write your site's domain (example : http://www.mysite.com).
column2: a) In the 'Application Domain' field, write your site's domain (example : http://www.mysite.com).

column1: b) Choose the 'Access Scopes' field to : 'This app requires access to private user data.'. Selecting this option will give you a list of Yahoo services. Among them, choose 'Yahoo! Contacts' in 'Read' mode.
column2: b) Choose the 'Access Scopes' field to : 'This app requires access to private user data.'. Selecting this option will give you a list of Yahoo services. Among them, choose 'Yahoo! Contacts' in 'Read' mode.

column1: c) Check on the 'Terms of Use' checkbox.
column2: c) Check on the 'Terms of Use' checkbox.

column1: d) Now click on the 'Get API Key' button. After clicking on this button you will be redirected to a store where it would ask you to verify your domain. So, verify your domain.
column2: d) Now click on the 'Get API Key' button. After clicking on this button you will be redirected to a Showroom where it would ask you to verify your domain. So, verify your domain.

column1: e) After verifying your domain successfully, you will be redirected to a success store where you will get your 'API Key' and 'Shared Secret Key'. Copy them and paste these values in your site's Yahoo contact importer settings fields.
column2: e) After verifying your domain successfully, you will be redirected to a success Showroom where you will get your 'API Key' and 'Shared Secret Key'. Copy them and paste these values in your site's Yahoo contact importer settings fields.
